header.title: The Invincible Magick Spells of The Afghan Mullah-Sensees

central_thesis: The book presents a collection of authentic, historically proven (1400 years old) spells and signs from Afghan Mullah-Sensees, intended solely for good works and positive outcomes, while strictly warning against misuse which will result in severe karmic retribution.

structure_content.summary: This section explains that the book's information comes from Mullah-Sensees (magical healers and magicians) and is for benevolent purposes only. It explicitly warns that using these spells for evil will lead to backfire. The spells and signs are described as originating from the mountains of Afghanistan, passed down for generations, and preserved in their original form. The author aims to provide insight into Afghan and Middle Asian magic, asserting the spells' efficacy over 1400 years.

This chapter focuses on love magic, noting its traditional use by men to attract multiple wives but affirming its general applicability. It includes a spell 'TO BE LOVED BY INFIDELS' (cast in Pushto, suitable for non-Muslims or anyone) and 'TO OBTAIN THE LOVE OF YOUR FOUR WIVES AND KEEP THEM FAITHFUL' (cast in Arabic). Both require holding a specific sign and reciting an incantation.

Details the historical methods of creating signs, such as using blue ink (olive oil and lapis-lazuli) on goat skin in northern Afghanistan, or green ink (Afghan emeralds) in the south and Persia. It acknowledges modern methods (ballpoint pen and paper), emphasizing that the power lies in the symbol itself, not the material or timing of its creation.

A spell explicitly for women, originating from Yemen and mentioned in the Quran. It involves tying nine knots in a piece of string while repeating a specific incantation that includes the name of the man concerned.

This section provides various protective spells. These include general 'FOR PROTECTION FROM ATTACK' (carrying a spell), 'FOR PROTECTION DURING MINING AND TO PREVENT MINES CAVING IN', and 'FOR PROTECTION FROM MAGIC AND EVIL THOUGHTS OF YOUR ENEMIES'. All involve carrying specific signs and sometimes reciting incantations.

structure_content.chapter_title: FOR INFLUENCING ALL BUSINESS AND MONEY VENTURES
structure_content.summary: A spell designed to attract wealth and good fortune. The practitioner is instructed to say 'ALHAMDOLILLAH RABIL AMEEN' before making business decisions, implicitly while also utilizing a provided sign.

Outlines a magical healing method where a specific sign is placed on the affected body area, and an incantation ('BISMILLAH-IRRAHMAN-IRRAHIIM' etc.) is repeated three times. It also briefly covers non-magical Arabic medicine remedies for common ailments like constipation, diarrhea, common cold, back pain, and eye problems, primarily involving pressure and rubbing techniques.

Includes a strong caution against using these spells to attack those who have caused no harm. It presents 'TO CAUSE CONFUSION AMONGST YOUR ENEMIES' (burying a sign with an incantation) and 'TO CAUSE THE DEMOLITION OF STRONGHOLDS' (a multi-part spell involving burying three distinct signs in specific locations around a stronghold, with a severe warning of practitioner death if misused against an innocent target).

structure_content.chapter_title: FOR PROTECTION IN BATTLE; ALSO FOR GOOD LUCK
structure_content.summary: Describes a protective sign said to have been used by Solomon. The instruction is to bind this sign to the head or tie it to the left arm for protection from injury and good luck.

structure_content.chapter_title: A Spell for Attracting Wealth and Good Fortune
structure_content.summary: This section reiterates or provides an additional spell for financial success, instructing the recitation of 'ALHAMDOLILLAH RABIL AMEEN' prior to business undertakings, accompanied by a specific sigil.

key_concepts.definition: Magical healers and magicians from Afghanistan and surrounding areas, identified as the originators and custodians of the spells and signs presented in the book.

The core operative components of the system. Spells are verbal incantations (often Arabic or Pushto phrases), and signs are hand-drawn esoteric symbols or sigils, meant to be held, carried, placed, or buried to effect magical change.

A severe karmic consequence explicitly warned against, stating that if spells are used for evil purposes or against innocent individuals, the malevolent intent will undoubtedly return to harm the practitioner.
One of the languages, specific to northern Afghanistan and Uzbekistan, used for casting certain spells, particularly for love magic involving non-Muslims.

The primary language for the construction of many signs and incantations, reflecting the Islamic cultural context from which these practices are derived, and based on ancient Arabic/Egyptian magical systems.
The publisher of the book, known within occult circles for releasing a variety of practical, often direct-action grimoire-style texts on different magical subjects.

practical_system.description: The practical system is an operative folk magic tradition centered on the use of specific 'spells' (incantations, often Islamic devotional phrases or Pushto phrases) combined with 'signs' (hand-drawn sigils or talismans). These elements are used in conjunction with simple physical actions (holding, carrying, burying, placing, looking, tying knots) to achieve various magical goals. The system is presented as historically proven and effective, requiring only the practitioner's adherence to instructions and a strict ethical code (using magic for good works only) to prevent severe karmic retribution.
tools: Hand-drawn signs/sigils (created with ordinary pen and paper, or historically with specific inks and goat skin)
The practitioner's right hand (for holding signs)
The affected area of the body (for healing spells)
The target individual (for observation in love spells)
rituals: To Be Loved by Infidels: Hold the specific sign in the right hand, look at the target person, quietly murmur the given Pushto spell until a change in their stance is observed, then introduce yourself.
To Obtain the Love of Your Four Wives: Hold the sign in the right hand or wallet, look at the wives, and repeat the Arabic spell three times.
For Sexual Vitality (Women Only): Obtain a piece of string, tie nine knots, and repeat the spell 'AN-NUS... (name of man concerned) IYA BUDU. AMEEN.' whilst tying each knot.
Spells for Protection (General): Carry the specific protection signs with you.
Spells for Healing: Place the healing sign on the affected area of the body and repeat the Arabic spell ('BISMILLAH-IRRAHMAN-IRRAHIIM' etc.) three times.
To Cause Confusion Amongst Your Enemies: Bury the specific sign in the garden of one of your enemies and say the provided Arabic spell.

To Cause the Demolition of Strongholds: Bury three distinct signs (Sign 1 in the enemy's garden/next to dwelling; Sign 2 near the west wall of the stronghold; Sign 3 near the east wall of the stronghold). Repeat the spell 'BISMILLAH-IRRAHMAN-IRRAHIIM' three times as you cover the signs.
For Protection in Battle / Good Luck: Bind the specific protection sign to your head or tie it to your left arm.
For Attracting Wealth and Good Fortune: Recite 'ALHAMDOLILLAH RABIL AMEEN' before making business decisions, implicitly while using the corresponding sign.

relevant_quotes.text: Every spell contained in this book has worked for over 1400 years and will work for you if you follow the directions of the Mullah-Sensees.
These spells and signs must not be used for evil purposes as evil will undoubtedly backfire on the user if the necessary precautions have not been taken.
The new methods have not affected the power of the spells or the signs, and although the methods of making them has changed, the signs and spells are still the same now as they were 1400 years ago.

IF YOU USE THIS SPELL TO ATTACK A PERSON OR STRONGHOLD WHO HAS NOT HARMED YOU, I AM CERTAIN YOU WOULD DIE WITHIN A WEEK. THE SPIRITS WOULD KNOW YOU WERE THE FIRST AGGRESSOR AND AS SUCH WOULD REPEL THE SPELL BACK TO THE PERSON WHO CAST IT. YOUR BODY WOULD BE DEMOLISHED AND YOU WOULD DIE FROM INTERNAL INJURIES. THE ONLY WAY TO STOP DEATH IS TO DIG THE SIGNS UP AND BURN THEM AT THE SAME TIME SAYING: BISMILLAH-IRRAHMAN-IRRAHIIM.

critical_analysis.relevance: This book provides a rare, direct glimpse into a specific tradition of Islamic folk magic from Afghanistan and Middle Asia, often distinct from mainstream Western ceremonial magic. Its value lies in presenting operative, results-focused magical techniques rooted in a specific cultural and religious context, offering a counterpoint to more theory-heavy or Qabalistic traditions. The ethical warnings about backfire and death for misuse are unusually stark and central, framing the entire practice within a strict moral imperative often absent or understated in other grimoire traditions. The emphasis on the authenticity and ancient lineage (1400 years) of the spells, despite modern methods of creation, speaks to a particular understanding of magical power as inherent to the symbol and utterance, rather than solely dependent on ritual purity of materials. The book can be contextualized as a 'working grimoire' focused on immediate practical application, similar to European grimoires, but with a unique regional flavor.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is practitioners of practical magic, particularly those interested in folk magic, cross-cultural occultism, or direct-action spellcasting. It caters to individuals seeking explicit instructions for specific outcomes (love, protection, wealth, healing, adversarial work) with minimal theoretical preamble. Due to the straightforward, step-by-step nature of the rituals, it could appeal to beginners, provided they conscientiously adhere to the extreme ethical warnings regarding malevolent applications.
